DataElement.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Grip Strength Dominant Hand Second Measurement Indicator Kilogram Value
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Numeric value to represent an individual's second grip strength in the dominant hand as measured in kilograms.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Johns Hopkins Frailty Assessment Calculator Grip Strength Dominant Hand Second Measurement Indicator
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0)._An assessment of hand muscle strength that measures that force with which one holds or grasps._The preferred hand of use for controlled and efficient performance of motor tasks._Coming next after the first in position in space or time or degree or magnitude._Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard._An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Concepts.definition: A standardized assessment tool that assesses frailty by measuring five phenotypic criteria: unintentional weight loss, exhaustion, low energy expenditure, low grip strength, and/or slowed walking speed. A single score is automatically generated and interpreted as either frail (score 3-5), pre-frail (score 1 or 2), or non-frail or robust (score 0).

Concepts.definition: An assessment of hand muscle strength that measures that force with which one holds or grasps.
The preferred hand of use for controlled and efficient performance of motor tasks.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An assessment of hand muscle strength that measures that force with which one holds or grasps._A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds._A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the results of evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: An assessment of hand muscle strength that measures that force with which one holds or grasps.:A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.:A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of hand muscle strength that measures that force with which one holds or grasps.

A basic SI unit of mass. It is defined as the mass of an international prototype in the form of a platinum-iridium cylinder kept at Sevres in France. A kilogram is equal to 1,000 grams and 2.204 622 6 pounds.
A numerical quantity measured or assigned or computed.
